title: Integrating Large Language Models in Political Discourse Studies on Social Media: Challenges of Validating an LLMs-in-the-loop
snippet: This paper references Fabio Giglietto's research (Giglietto, 2024) demonstrating that LLMs outperform fully fine-tuned transformer models in NLP tasks. He is also listed as being from the Department of Communication Sciences, Humanities and International Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo.
description: This paper discusses the challenges of using Large Language Models in political discourse studies on social media, referencing Fabio Giglietto's 2024 research on LLMs outperforming fine-tuned transformer models. It also lists him as being from the Department of Communication Sciences, Humanities and International Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo.

title: All Articles – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: This page mentions a project by vera.ai, entitled “The Persistence and Resilience of Misinformation in the Face of Fact Checking,” was facilitated by Fabio Giglietto, Massimo Terenzi (UNIURB) and Richard Rogers (UvA) at the Digital Media Initiative Winter School at the University of Amsterdam. It also mentions a video recording of a talk by Fabio Giglietto of the University of Urbino, given in June 2023 at the Queensland University of Technology (QUT) about using OpenAI models to identify the most salient topics circulated via Facebook links in the run-up to the Italian general elections.
description: The vera.ai "All Articles" page mentions Fabio Giglietto's facilitation of a Digital Media Initiative Winter School project on misinformation and a talk he gave at QUT in June 2023 about using OpenAI models for election analysis on Facebook.

title: Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it

Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: This article is an interview format that presents the team from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo working on the vera.ai project. Fabio Giglietto is mentioned as the leader of the team, as an Associate Professor at the Department of Communication Sciences, Humanities, and International Studies, and coordinator of the Mapping Italian News Research Program at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo. The team's objective is to discover potentially problematic content in near-real-time using social media analysis and network science methods.
description: The article interviews the University of Urbino Carlo Bo team working on the vera.ai project, led by Fabio Giglietto, and discusses their work on identifying problematic content using social media analysis.

title: L'Europa assolda Urbino contro le fake-news - Il Resto del Carlino
snippet: This article details how the European Union invested 7 million euros in the Vera.ai project, supported by the Horizon Europe Framework Programme, to combat disinformation. A team coordinated by Fabio Giglietto, professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino, will receive 400,000 euros as a partner in the project, along with 14 other international universities, newsrooms, and research institutions. Giglietto discusses the urgency of addressing disinformation and the motivations behind spreading fake news.
description: The article reports on the Vera.ai project funded by the European Union to combat disinformation, highlighting Fabio Giglietto, professor at the University of Urbino, as the coordinator of the research team receiving 400,000 euros.

title: Fabio Giglietto - Festival Internazionale del Giornalismo
snippet: This page mentions Fabio Giglietto as a researcher at the Department of Communication Sciences, Humanities and International Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, where he teaches Social Media Analysis. It also mentions his involvement in the NEWS-ITALIA project.
description: The content is a speaker profile for Fabio Giglietto at the Festival Internazionale del Giornalismo. It describes him as a researcher at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo and mentions his teaching of Social Media Analysis and involvement in the NEWS-ITALIA project.
